intro: Pratia puberula f. arguta, commonly known as the hairy pratia, is a variant of the Pratia puberula species, which belongs to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually opposite and oval-shaped, with a velvety texture due to the dense pubescence. The flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, are clustered in cymes and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
